instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pp3v42 shorted
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

very clean looking board. No obvious liquid damage anywhere.

pp3v42 0.2v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.585v

short to ground on pp3v42.
removed L7095 - short is on system side (pin2) 0v diode mode 0ohm
spent some time removing caps on pp3v42(to oneside then checking for short then putting back) 
<CAPACITOR>C5120</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C7099</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7098</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7095</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C9510</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C3740</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7102</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C4820</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C4650</CAPACITOR>

tried injecting some voltage into pp3v42 (pin 2 l7095 with it removed) 
i'm concerned about putting to much power into this rail - the schematic says 300ma max - i hit that at 0.3v what is "safe" to put into pp3v42 ?, previously shorts here have been obvious for me.

Any suggestions please ? - possibly shorted SMC ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pp3v42 shorted
threads.message: You can put 1-2A into it without problem just don't go over 3V, something should heat up, SMC is the first suspect.
